qas.question: Where is the upper canal regulation of the Rhine?
What is the lower canal regulation of the Rhine?
Besides constant flooding, why else was there regulation of the Rhine?

answers.text: strong sedimentation in the western Rhine Delta

qas.question: After the Dornbirner Ach was diverted, where does the Rhine flow now?

answers.text: parallel to the canalized Rhine into the lake.

qas.question: What is expected with the continuous input of sediment into the Dornbirner Ach?

answers.text: the continuous input of sediment into the lake will silt up the lake

qas.question: Where was the Rhine regulated with a lower canal?
Where was the Rhine regulated with an upper canal?

answers.text: to counteract the constant flooding and strong sedimentation in the western Rhine Delta
to counteract the constant flooding and strong sedimentation

qas.question: What was diverted and now flows parallel to the Rhine?
What will cause the lake near the Rhine to silt up?

answers.text: It is expected that the continuous input of sediment into the lake will silt up the lake
continuous input of sediment into the lake

qas.question: Where is the western canal regulation of the Rhine?
Where is the eastern canal regulation of the Rhine?
What has water that is a lighter color than the Rhine?
What lake no longer has any silt?

context: A regulation of the Rhine was called for, with an upper canal <a0_2><a6_2>near <a0_0><a0_1><a0_3><a6_0><a6_1><a6_3><b10_0>Diepoldsau<b10_0/><a6_3/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> and a lower canal at <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><a5_0><a5_1><a5_2><a5_3><b11_0>Fußach<b11_0/><a5_3/><a5_2/><a5_1/><a5_0/><a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, in order <a7_2><a7_3>to counteract the <a7_0><a7_1><b13_0>constant flooding<a7_0/> and <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>strong sedimentation<b13_0/><a7_3/><a7_1/><a2_3/><a2_1/><a2_0/> in the western Rhine Delta<a7_2/><a2_2/>. <a8_2><b12_0>The <a8_0><a8_1><a8_3>Dornbirner Ach<b12_0/><a8_3/><a8_2/><a8_1/><a8_0/> had to be diverted, too, and it now flows <a3_0><a3_2>parallel to <a3_1>the canalized Rhine<a3_1/><a3_0/> <a3_3>into the lake<a3_3/>.<a3_2/> Its water has a darker color than the Rhine; the latter's lighter suspended load comes from higher up the mountains. <a9_2>It is expected that <a4_2>the <a9_0><a9_1><a9_3>continuous input of sediment<a9_1/><a9_0/> into the lake<a9_3/> will <a4_0><a4_1><a4_3>silt<a4_0/> up the lake<a9_2/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/>.
